name: Mexican Shredded Chicken
description: 5 minutes prep is all that's required for this shredded chicken tossed in a smokey, mildly spicy red sauce that's loaded with flavour. Make this in your slow cooker, pressure cooker or on the stove - directions provided for all!
recipeIngredient: 1.5 lb / 750g   chicken breast (, skinless boneless (~3 halves))
1/2 cup Chipotles in Adobo Sauce ((4 chillies + sauce) (Note 1))
1 tsp EACH dried oregano, cumin powder and onion powder (or garlic powder)

itemListElement.text: Slow Cooker: Place Chicken & Sauce ingredients in the slow cooker and cook for 4 hours on low. The chicken is ready when it can be shredded easily with 2 forks but it should NOT be mushy (i.e. overcooked).
itemListElement.name: Slow Cooker: Place Chicken & Sauce ingredients in the slow cooker and cook for 4 hours on low. The chicken is ready when it can be shredded easily with 2 forks but it should NOT be mushy (i.e. overcooked).

itemListElement.text: Stove: Place Chicken & Sauce ingredients in a medium saucepan and add 1 cup water. Simmer covered on medium low for 40 - 50 minutes, turning chicken occasionally, until chicken can be shredded with 2 forks.
itemListElement.name: Stove: Place Chicken & Sauce ingredients in a medium saucepan and add 1 cup water. Simmer covered on medium low for 40 - 50 minutes, turning chicken occasionally, until chicken can be shredded with 2 forks.

itemListElement.text: Remove chicken and shred. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Remove chicken and shred. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Add lime juice (to taste) and 1 tbsp olive oil to the sauce. Use a stick blender (or transfer to blender) to puree the sauce. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. You should have about 2 cups of sauce.
itemListElement.name: Add lime juice (to taste) and 1 tbsp olive oil to the sauce. Use a stick blender (or transfer to blender) to puree the sauce. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. You should have about 2 cups of sauce.

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add 1/3 to 1/2 the chicken and fry until dark golden brown on one side, flip and cook the other side very briefly (don't brown), then remove. Use 1 tbsp oil for each batch you fry.
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add 1/3 to 1/2 the chicken and fry until dark golden brown on one side, flip and cook the other side very briefly (don't brown), then remove. Use 1 tbsp oil for each batch you fry.

itemListElement.text: Toss chicken in the sauce OR serve it on the side.
itemListElement.name: Toss chicken in the sauce OR serve it on the side.

itemListElement.text: Use for tacos (guacamole and Pico de Gallo, enchiladas, burritos, on green Mexican rice, quesadillas, sliders, on tostadas.
itemListElement.name: Use for tacos (guacamole and Pico de Gallo, enchiladas, burritos, on green Mexican rice, quesadillas, sliders, on tostadas.

review.reviewBody: omfg so yum! I didn't brown the chicken but this was so easy and full of flavour. will be adding this to my favourites!

I just want to thank you for this recipe. It has been on heavy rotation in our household for years now and we all still absolutely love it! We use this chicken for a whole range of dishes from super healthy Mexican ‚ÄòBuddha‚Äô bowls, to cheesy enchiladas, and the ultimate quick mid week tortillas or nachos. Depending on time constraints, I‚Äôve done this in both the slow cooker and pressure cooker and both work well. It‚Äôs just so good! üòã
This is great although I may have over done the chillies. Any tips for calming the sauce down for the kids. I‚Äôve added more sugar but it‚Äôs still too spicy for them.
This was one of my first Nagi recipes and has been made many times since. So delicious! Thanks Nagi for all your amazing recipes. ‚ù§‚ù§

This is amazing!!  I cooked in my pressure cooker exactly per the recipe and hubby‚Äôs words were ‚ÄúThis has to be our go to chicken  taco recipe!‚Äù  I did double and kept the sauce separate and tomorrow we will make quesadillas with the leftovers!!

I am teaching my high school senior son how to make easy meals that can be made quickly and taste amazing.  This recipe is definitely another winner Nagi!  Thank you for continued keepers to our go-to favorites!!

Hi! Love this! Make it often-every few weeks- I always have so much sauce left over.....could I use it to make your Mexican Red Rice...or maybe freeze it and make another batch of the shredded chicken...So Yum!
Absolutely delicious!! I've made this four times now it's excellent üëå As an update as well, you can now get chipotle in Adobe sauce in Coles and Woolies!

An absolute winner. My 8th time making this tonight and it's just as mind blowing as the first time I made it for our family. 
üíï

YUM! Made this delicious Mexican Shredded Chicken tonight to fill soft tacos. Also added shredded cabbage, charred corn kernels, spring onion, coriander and plain yoghurt. Lots of sauce left over for me to use in Chilli Dog recipe tomorrow night. Nagi recipes 2 nights in a row- woohoo.
My family loves this chicken.  I am cooking it for the 3rd time tonight.

Tried this and it's EXCELLENT!!
Had a chicken taco urge, this with some pico, avo, and that sauce!! You could bottle that stuff!
Highly recommend trying this one!!

I make this dish often and always a winner and super easy. 

Question - I often have lots of the sauce left over, what can I do with this?  Can I cook a chicken breast in the sauce or will it not absorb the flavours as well? 

Thanks!
